intro: Scleria baroni-clarkei, commonly known as the African flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist soils along riverbanks and in swampy areas. Its flowering spikes produce small, pale blue or white flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Scleria baroni-clarkei is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various water conditions.
